N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 77.1 - Introduction

State Regulations
(a) As used in this

Part "physical plant" or "physical facilities" refer to all buildings, structures, land, land improvements or other appurtenances on the site of a
hospital for the mentally ill, residential school for the mentally retarded, or
alcoholism facility certified or to be certified or constructed in accordance
with article 13 of the Mental Hygiene Law. (b) This Part shall not apply to any facility
operated as part of a general hospital as defined in section
2801
of the

Public Health Law. Such facilities shall meet requirements established in the

State Hospital Code. (c) This Part
shall not apply to any facility established by article 7 of the Mental Hygiene

Law or Part 55 of this Title. (d) This Part shall apply to all existing facilities in these classes in accordance
with the provisions of section
77.11
of this Part. (e) Living units are those places within the
facility wherein patients or residents sleep or engage in unorganized activity
including bedrooms, lounges, bathrooms, corridors, and other spaces appurtenant
thereto. (f) As used in this Part
waive or waiver shall mean the act of removing the application to a facility of
a specific provision of this Part upon application by the facility and for good
cause shown. (g) As used in this

Part defer or deferral shall mean the act of postponing application to a
facility of a specific provision of this Part upon application by the facility
showing a plan designed to produce compliance at a scheduled future
time. Notes
